# Slack Notify Plugin

Real-time Slack notifications for Claude Code task completions with repository context and flexible configuration.

## Features

- Automatic notifications when TodoWrite tasks complete
- Git changes tracking (modified, added, deleted files)
- Execution time tracking
- Error/warning reporting
- Configurable via environment variables or config file

## Installation

```bash
claude plugin install devnogari-claude-plugins/slack-notify
```

## Configuration

Set environment variable:
```bash
export SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL="https://hooks.slack.com/services/YOUR/WEBHOOK/URL"
```

Or create `.slack-notify.json` in your project root.

## Usage

### Automatic (Default)
Notifications are sent automatically when Claude Code sessions complete with tracked tasks.

### Manual
```bash
/devnogari:slack-notify
```

## Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/devnogari:slack-notify` | Manual notification trigger |

## Hooks

| Hook | Script | Purpose |
|------|--------|---------|
| SessionStart | `init-session.sh` | Initialize session tracking |
| Stop | `auto-notify-hook.sh` | Send completion notification |

## Environment Variables

| Variable | Description | Default |
|----------|-------------|---------|
| `SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL` | Slack incoming webhook URL | Required |
| `SLACK_NOTIFY_ENABLED` | Enable/disable notifications | `true` |
| `SLACK_NOTIFY_MIN_TASKS` | Minimum tasks to trigger | `1` |
| `SLACK_NOTIFY_DEBUG` | Enable debug logging | `false` |

# PR Review Automation Plugin

Automated PR review feedback processing with Gemini bot integration, priority-based filtering, state tracking, and Ralph-loop autonomous processing.

## Features

- Automatic Gemini bot feedback detection and processing
- Priority-based filtering (CRITICAL > IMPORTANT > NICE-TO-HAVE)
- State tracking for resumable processing
- Ralph-loop integration for fully autonomous operation
- Cross-repository support

## Installation

```bash
claude plugin install devnogari-claude-plugins/pr-review-automation
```

## Prerequisites

- GitHub CLI (`gh`) installed and authenticated
- Node.js and npm
- jq (optional, for JSON filtering)

## Usage

### Auto Mode (Ralph-loop - Default)
```bash
/devnogari:pr-review auto
```

This automatically executes Ralph-loop for fully autonomous processing.

### Manual Mode
```bash
npm run pr-state -- --pr <PR_NUMBER>
npm run pr-loop -- --wait
```

## Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/devnogari:pr-review` | PR review automation |
| `/devnogari:pr-review auto` | Autonomous Ralph-loop processing |

## Priority Levels

| Priority | Label | Action |
|----------|-------|--------|
| ğŸ”´ CRITICAL | HIGH | Always fix |
| ğŸŸ¡ IMPORTANT | MEDIUM | Always fix |
| ğŸŸ¢ NICE-TO-HAVE | LOW | Fix if meaningful |
| âšª NITPICK | VERY_LOW | Skip |
| âŒ FALSE POSITIVE | IGNORE | Skip |

## Scripts

| Script | Purpose |
|--------|---------|
| `pr-review-state.ts` | State management and feedback tracking |
| `pr-review-loop.ts` | Polling loop for feedback detection |
| `pr-review-auto.sh` | Automation orchestration |

## Exit Codes

| Code | Meaning |
|------|---------|
| 0 | No meaningful feedback (done) |
| 2 | Meaningful feedback found (needs processing) |
| 1 | Error occurred |

# Feature Workflow Plugin

TDD-based feature implementation workflow with git worktree isolation, LSP-first exploration, Ralph-loop code review, and parallel execution.

## Features

- Auto-detection of project type (React+Vite, Next.js, Go+Gin, Flutter)
- 7-phase checkpoint system
- Git worktree isolation
- TDD-first approach
- **LSP-first exploration** (mandatory for code navigation)
- Parallel subagent execution
- **Ralph-loop code review** (autonomous review until no meaningful issues)
- Gate verification scripts

## Prerequisites

This plugin requires the following external dependencies:

| Dependency | Purpose | Required |
|------------|---------|----------|
| `ralph-loop` plugin | Autonomous code review loop (Phase 6) | **Yes** |
| `superpowers:code-reviewer` | Code review execution | Yes (built-in) |
| LSP server for your language | LSP-first exploration (Phase 3) | Recommended |

### Installing Ralph-Loop

```bash
# Ralph-loop is required for Phase 6 (Code Review Loop)
claude plugin install ralph-loop
```

## Installation

```bash
claude plugin install devnogari-claude-plugins/feature-workflow
```

## Usage

This skill loads **directly into session** - no file installation required.

```bash
/feature-workflow:feature-workflow "implement user settings page"
```

When invoked, feature-workflow **delegates to feature-dev:feature-dev** which orchestrates the 7-phase workflow.

The skill auto-detects your project type (vite.config, go.mod, pubspec.yaml, etc.) and applies the appropriate workflow patterns.

## Supported Project Types

| Type | Detection File | Stack |
|------|---------------|-------|
| react-vite | `vite.config.ts` | React + Vite + pnpm |
| nextjs | `next.config.js` | Next.js + pnpm |
| go-gin | `go.mod` | Go + Gin + fx |
| flutter | `pubspec.yaml` | Flutter + Clean Architecture |

## 7-Phase Workflow

1. **Git Worktree Setup** - Isolated feature branch
2. **TDD - Write Tests First** - Tests before implementation
3. **Implementation (LSP FIRST!)** - LSP-first exploration + Parallel subagents
4. **Build & Verification** - TypeScript/Go/Dart checks
5. **Local Testing** - Real backend integration
6. **Code Review Loop (Ralph-Loop!)** - Autonomous review until no meaningful issues
7. **Commit & Push** - Final delivery

### LSP-First Pattern (Phase 3)

| Task | Use LSP | âŒ NOT This |
|------|---------|------------|
| Find definition | `LSP goToDefinition` | grep/glob |
| File symbols | `LSP documentSymbol` | cat/read file |
| Project search | `LSP workspaceSymbol` | grep |
| Find references | `LSP findReferences` | grep |

### Ralph-Loop Code Review (Phase 6)

```bash
/ralph-loop "Code review for {feature}..." --completion-promise "CODE_REVIEW_DONE" --max-iterations 10
```

- Automatically fixes Critical/Important issues
- Continues until `meaningfulUnprocessedCount = 0`
- No manual re-request needed

## Checkpoint System

| Symbol | Status |
|--------|--------|
| `[P1:_]` | Pending |
| `[P1:*]` | In Progress |
| `[P1:V]` | Verified |
| `[P1:X]` | Failed |
| `[P1:>]` | Skipped |

## Project-Specific Templates

The following templates are bundled for reference (no installation needed):
- `react-vite.md` - React + Vite workflow
- `nextjs.md` - Next.js workflow
- `go-gin.md` - Go + Gin workflow
- `flutter.md` - Flutter workflow

# Code Patterns Plugin

**Enforces** consistent code patterns with PreToolUse hooks that **block** violations.

## v2.0.0 - Active Enforcement

This plugin now uses **PreToolUse hooks** to actually enforce patterns, not just remind about them.

### What Gets Blocked

| Action | Condition | Result |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| `Grep`/`Glob` | Pattern looks like symbol search | **BLOCKED** - Use LSP |
| `git commit` | Code changes without review | **BLOCKED** - Review first |
| `git push` | Code changes without review | **BLOCKED** - Review first |

### What Gets Tracked

| Tool | Action |
|------|--------|
| `Edit` | Code file changes tracked |
| `Write` | Code file changes tracked |

## Hooks Configuration

```json
{
  "hooks": {
    "PreToolUse": [
      { "matcher": "Grep|Glob", "command": "check-lsp-first.sh" },
      { "matcher": "Bash", "command": "check-review-before-commit.sh" }
    ],
    "PostToolUse": [
      { "matcher": "Edit|Write", "command": "track-code-changes.sh" }
    ]
  }
}
```

## Workflow

```
1. Code change (Edit/Write) â†’ Tracked automatically
2. More changes â†’ Count increases
3. git commit attempt â†’ BLOCKED if no review
4. Run code review (superpowers:code-reviewer)
5. /code-patterns:review-done â†’ Marks review complete
6. git commit â†’ Allowed
```

| `CODE_PATTERNS_ALLOW_GREP=true` | Skip LSP enforcement |
| `CODE_PATTERNS_SKIP_REVIEW=true` | Skip review gate |
| `CODE_PATTERNS_DEBUG=true` | Enable debug output |

## Installation

```bash
claude plugin install code-patterns@devnogari-claude-plugins
```

## Patterns Enforced

### 1. LSP First (ENFORCED)

| Task | Use LSP | NOT This |
|------|---------|----------|
| Find definition | `goToDefinition` | grep/glob |
| File symbols | `documentSymbol` | cat/read |
| Project symbols | `workspaceSymbol` | grep |
| Find references | `findReferences` | grep |
| Type info | `hover` | read file |
| Implementations | `goToImplementation` | grep |
| Call graph | `incomingCalls`/`outgoingCalls` | manual |

### 2. Subagent Delegation (MANDATORY)

| Condition | Agent |
|-----------|-------|
| 3+ file exploration | `Explore` |
| 3+ step implementation | `Plan` |
| Code structure changes | `refactoring-expert` |
| After code changes | `superpowers:code-reviewer` |
| Bug analysis | `root-cause-analyst` |
| Security review | `security-engineer` |
| Performance issues | `performance-engineer` |

### 3. Mandatory Code Review (ENFORCED)

Code review is **REQUIRED** before commit:
1. Code changes tracked automatically
2. Commit blocked until review done
3. Use `superpowers:code-reviewer` agent
4. Run `/code-patterns:review-done` to clear gate
files.plugins/best-practices/README.md:
# Best Practices Plugin

Comprehensive best practices (40+ rules per framework) with auto-detection and codebase auditing.

## Quick Start

```bash
# Load and audit codebase
/best-practices:best-practices

# Load without audit
/best-practices:best-practices --no-audit

# Install to project (optional)
/devnogari:best-practices-init
```

## Supported Project Types

| Type | Detection | Focus |
|------|-----------|-------|
| **react-vite** | `vite.config.ts/js` | Bundle optimization, re-render prevention, state management |
| **nextjs** | `next.config.js/mjs/ts` | Waterfall elimination, RSC patterns, caching |
| **go-gin** | `go.mod` | Error handling, concurrency, Gin patterns |
| **flutter** | `pubspec.yaml` | Widget optimization, BLoC/state, async patterns |
| **python-fastapi** | `uv.lock` / `pyproject.toml` / `requirements.txt` + fastapi | Async patterns, DI, Pydantic, SQLAlchemy |
| **kotlin-multiplatform** | `settings.gradle.kts` / `build.gradle.kts` + `kotlin("multiplatform")` | Compose state, Coroutines, Koin DI, Ktor client |
| **kotlin-spring** | `build.gradle.kts` + `spring-boot-starter-webflux` | Coroutines, Flow, R2DBC, WebFlux, reactive security |

## Plugin Structure

Templates are located in the plugin directory:

```
${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/plugins/best-practices/skills/best-practices/
â”œâ”€â”€ SKILL.md           # Main skill with detection & audit
â””â”€â”€ templates/         # Framework-specific rulesets
    â”œâ”€â”€ react-vite/
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ SKILL.md   # React+Vite rules (45+)
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ rules/     # Detailed rule files
    â”œâ”€â”€ go-gin/
    â”œâ”€â”€ flutter/
    â””â”€â”€ ...
```

The `${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}` variable resolves to the plugin installation directory.

## Options

- `--type <type>` - Force specific project type
- `--force` - Overwrite existing installation

## Examples

```bash
# Auto-detect and install
/devnogari:best-practices-init

# Force Next.js type
/devnogari:best-practices-init --type nextjs

# Reinstall
/devnogari:best-practices-init --force
```

## Integration

The skill automatically activates when:
- Writing new code in the detected framework
- Reviewing or refactoring existing code
- Optimizing performance
- Conducting code reviews

## Inspired By

- [vercel-react-best-practices](https://vercel.com/docs) - Vercel Engineering's React/Next.js guidelines
- Go community best practices
- Flutter official performance guide
- Kotlin Multiplatform official documentation
- JetBrains Compose Multiplatform guidelines
- Spring Framework Kotlin Coroutines documentation
- Spring Boot 4.0 with Kotlin 2.x best practices
